results.title: 'round and 'round
results.creator_credit: Barbara Greene, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When Alex Lawson, minister, came to Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan, he recognized the need for a family self-help program. In cooperation with his parishioners, he organized the Minto Family Life Education Program. Through group meetings, they are learning new skills to help them restructure their lives and resolve personal problems. Though the people participating in this program live in a small Prairie town, their concerns are universal, like raising children, adolescence, loneliness, marital strife and alcoholism.

results.title: 'Rivers of fire': an eruption of Hawaii's Mauna Loa Volcano
results.creator_credit: Les Malzman, Jon Erickson, Kathleen English, United States. National Park Service and Hawaii Natural History Association
results.brief_description: Examines the twenty two day eruption of Mauna Loa, the world’s largest volcano which started on 25 March 1984. Explains the Hawaiian volcanoes with spectacular photography within a well structured presentation which includes excellent graphics of plate tectonics and the hot spot theory.

results.title: 'Estampa flamenca'
results.creator_credit: Dave Ellis and Dave Ellis Films
results.brief_description: This film features Maria Benitez, one of the world’s great flamenco dancers, in rehearsal and performance in her native New Mexico. She discusses the Gypsy and Spanish origins of flamenco with members of her dance company, Estampa Flamenca. Narrated by Jose Rodriguez

results.title: 'Murder ahoy'
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Lawrence P. Bachmann and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A sea-going whodunit where the intrepid Miss Marple finds herself investigating events on the HMS Battledore, a navy training ship designed to give young hoodlums a chance at new lives. Miss Marple discovers some-one is training the delinquents to be good thieves instead of good citizens and is willing to kill to keep the fact quiet! Murder Ahoy features a rogues gallery of suspects and ingenious means of despatching victims including strychnine-laced snuff, a poisoned mousetrap and a noose from a yard-arm. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Lionel Jeffries and Stringer Davis.

results.title: 'E'
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Under the guise of a pretty fairy tale, this animated film makes a strong political statement. Paper cut-outs enact a drama in which a dictator, suffering from a visual defect which affects his perception of things, imposes his delusions on his unfortunate subjects. The humour is black and despite an absence of dialogue the message is clear. (Awards: Berlin, Cracow, Zagreb, Gijon, Barcelona, New York)

results.title: 'M' [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Seymour Nebenzal and Nero-Film
results.brief_description: Peter Lorre in his greatest role portrays a psychotic child molester - a pathetic vagabond figure who experiences a frenzy at the sight of tender young school girls, and try as he may, he is unable to control the fervour of his criminal inclinations. The police disregard his letters of confession to them as the work of a lunatic, leaving the underworld to take the law into their own hands. The stylised realism of the sets and the detachment with which the opposing forces of law and outlawry are portrayed place this now classic film within the ambit of the so-called ‘new objectivity’ which was a reaction in Germany to the expressionist movement. This version is the longest available.

results.title: 'A'
results.creator_credit: Renate Duhr, Jan Lenica and Argos Films Borresholm
results.brief_description: A bitter, pessimistic cartoon, showing man’s utter helplessness in the face of forces stronger than himself. A man’s home is invaded by the letter “A”. Guile, flattery, magic, brute strength fail to remove this enemy. He gives up all hope - then discovers that “A” has disappeared. After a period of doubt he is delighted to be alone again. Suddenly “B” appears! In fine line pen-and-ink style reminiscent of 19th century engraving, Jan Lenica has created a visual joke based on one of Eugene Ionesco’s quotations. The letters also symbolise privacy, oppression or one’s own problems. (Awards: Grand Prize for Film Animation, Oberhausen Festival)

constellations_primary.name: Suburban scenes (Lisa McCune)
constellations_primary.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

results.title: 'Colleges classiques' in Quebec
results.creator_credit: Pierre Patry, Leonard Forest and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Founded on a study of the humanities, the classical colleges of Quebec have no exact counterpart elsewhere. This film explores their origins and shows how the classics still open the door to the wisdom of the ages. However, changes are being introduced, including greater emphasis on the sciences.

results.title: 'At the movies': Tim Burton masterclass with Margaret Pomeranz
results.brief_description: Hosted by Margaret Pomeranz, this masterclass reveals the workings behind Tim Burton’s creative genius, offering insight into his creative process with a rare view into his world of melancholic misfits, gothic suburbia and contemporary fairytales.
